etymology.description: Pictogram: calyx of a flower; negation sense back-formed from 否 (口 + 不); also interpreted as a bird flying toward the sky (一).
etymology.interpretation: Originally a drawing of a flower’s calyx, the graph later acquired the meaning ‘not’ when it participated in the formation of 否 (“mouth” + 不) for negation, and that sense was transferred back to 不. The botanical meaning was reassigned to 柎, while some traditional scholars reimagined the form as a bird flying upward toward the sky line to evoke the idea of negation.

examples.chinese: 我不喜欢咖啡(我不喜歡咖啡)。
今天不去学校(今天不去學校)。
examples.english: I’m not going to school today.
